page.title: 01ST.HELIER
page.content: St.Helier is the capital of Jersey. The town is the centre of most aspects of island life, e.g. government, commerce, entertainment. The town is situated on the south coast at the eastern end of St.Aubin's Bay. Very busy in the tourist season, it is the main shopping centre and has many important places of interest eg. the Town Church, Fort Regent, Elizabeth Castle, the States Building. The town is a communications centre with the Weighbridge bus station; the harbour has daily services to Guernsey, Alderney, Sark, Britain and France. A wide range of accomodation is available from small guest houses to large hotels. There are many hire car companies and coach tour operators, and numerous cafes and restaurants.
